intro: Ageratina zaragozana, commonly known as the Zaragoza ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, fluffy white or pale blue flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Ageratina zaragozana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
